question: Which of the following is true about an adiabatic wall?
option1: it allows flow of heat from one system to another
option2: it allows flow of particles from one system to another
option3: it does not allow flow of heat from one system to another
answer: it does not allow flow of heat from one system to another
explanation: An adiabatic wall is an insulating wall (can be movable) that does not allow flow of energy (heat) from one to another.
